definition: to sit down
surname Zuo
to sit/to take a seat/to take (a bus, airplane etc)/to bear fruit/variant of 座[zuo4]
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: Sit down and plan out a strategy for defeating your doubt.
sentences.chinese: 坐下来然后制定一项击败怀疑的计划。

sentences.english: Then they would sit down to nibble on the cheese.
sentences.chinese: 然后他们才会坐下来咀嚼奶酪。

sentences.english: After sitting down, he is abrupt buccal foam dies.
sentences.chinese: 坐下后，他突然口吐白沫死亡。

sentences.english: The tight shirt rides up out of the trousers when I sit down.
sentences.chinese: 我一坐下这件紧身衬衫就从裤子里跑到上面来了。

sentences.english: Most school counselors have offices where you can sit down and talk.
sentences.chinese: 大多数学校的辅导员都有办公室，你能坐下来谈谈。

sentences.english: He smiled and touched the ground with his hand, meaning that I should sit down.
sentences.chinese: 他微笑着并用手轻触着地面，示意我坐下。

sentences.english: When the panels started, I took a lonely seat in the back.
sentences.chinese: 当演讲开始时，我独自在后面找了个座位坐下。

sentences.english: But they cannot sit and discuss.
sentences.chinese: 但是他们不会坐下来讨论。

sentences.english: Get many empty seat, everyone orderly and sit down.
sentences.chinese: 上车后还有许多空座位，大家都有序的坐下了。

sentences.english: There are times when I sit down and have a good weep.
sentences.chinese: 有时候我会坐下来痛痛快快地哭一场。

sentences.english: He seated us and called to his daughter to bring tea.
sentences.chinese: 他让我们坐下，然后叫他女儿端茶来。

sentences.english: Then she sat down and laid her head on Babs' arm.
sentences.chinese: 然后，她坐下来，把头枕在芭布斯的胳膊上。

sentences.english: The dwarf sat down and the elf rang the little brass bell.
sentences.chinese: 侏儒坐下来，而小仙人摇了那小铜铃。

sentences.english: She then confounds me by sitting down to eat the free meal.
sentences.chinese: 她之后坐下吃免费餐食的行为则让我困惑。

sentences.english: He sat down and called for some beer.
sentences.chinese: 他坐下来要了一些啤酒。

definition: to be seated
to sit properly/to sit up straight
to sit down/to take a seat
to sit down
to seat (sb in a restaurant etc)/to take one's seat
to get up/to leave/to set forth
chair/CL:把[ba3],套[tao4]
to stand up
to get up on hind legs (esp. of horse)/to stand/to spring up
surname Zuo
to sit/to take a seat/to take (a bus, airplane etc)/to bear fruit/variant of 座[zuo4]
stool/small seat
to retire/to withdraw/to retreat/to step down
to squat down/to crouch
to lie down
to call out to/to greet/to say hello to/to inform/to take care of/to take care that one does not
to sit on the ground or the floor (idiom)
